reviews.text: A great experience during which you can catch a memorable glimpse of this floating palace. The mall connected to it is however quite ordinary....up side: bus stop is just right in front of the mall. About half an hour from city centre

A unique flash back to a time when Britain ruled the waves, though this was through diplomacy than fire power. The engineering below decks is as impressive as the state dining rooms above decks and the different accomodation areas show the differences between the all prevailing class structure of the time.
Oh, and the cafe I wonderful too!

Easy to get to as the no  .22, 34,or 35 bus goes straight to the ocean termini. Head to the shopping centre ,to the second floor. 
Your given headphones to listen to commentary on the ship.

You start from the top level and work your way to the engine room at the bottom. You get to see the Queens bedrooms ,banqueting room ,below desk,engine room. Its fantastic. 

Really lovely cafe with gorgeous freshly made scones and the shop at the end has some lovely gifts to bring home.

Fantastic morning all round

Great tour, lots to see. The Yacht itself is very big. The audio is very informative. Certain places are inaccessible. Not hard to imagine the Royal family on board! There's even a car on board. Staff are friendly. Tea Room is clean and service is great. Well worth it.

First time visit to the Britannia. Very nice tour with lots of interesting stuff to see. You get one of those audio guide type hand sets to use, which means you can wander about at you own pace and even hear again incase you missed something. Would highly recommend the tea room. There we had soup and sandwiches with tea, which was all very tasty and very filling. The staff in the tea room were very polite and courteous, having said that all the staff in and around the ship were. Would highly recommend a visit if you in the area.

It's a nice shopping mall, with a view of the surrounding harbor; it has a food court with plenty of options and a several-story parking lot. You can get there by car or by public transport (well organized by the way, I recommend the day ticket if you're a frequent traveller). One of the ships the Queen used is there, decommissioned and attached to the mall; you can visit it for a fee.

It is a huge place filled with different stores, they all have different closing times as well so you better get there soon. There are also stores for almost all occasions ranging from tech to clothing. Although there is no reception signal or internet, it is still a great place to go and shop at
Great place for a day out shopping and eating!!  Great choices for food.  Transgression Park inside and free car park so handy for kids and family.
A good shopping centre and unusually these days most of the units inside have been taken up. Car parking though at either end of the shopping area is very tight.
Great range of shops and facility's. Good parking and transport links. And not far out from Edinburgh Centre.
Top of the best breakfast and Super nice and friendly staff! It is worth A visit! Italian cappuccino they make is amazing!

My daughter and I were visiting from Canada and stumbled on this place two blocks from where we were staying. It was incredible. The food was amazing, the chai latte was perfect and the staff were great. We went back two days in a row and would have gone a lot more of we had found it sooner! I'll be back for sure!

A fantastic and well priced Cafe that's lasted over the years, understated and friendly. All homemade food, locally sourced. Well worth a visit either for a snack , meal or cooked breakfast. Coffee roasters on site, now that's worth the visit alone.
The food was sssoooooo good. My friends and I went there everyday for breakfast. It's a very cosy place with limited seating but the employees are willing to help you find a seat. :-)

Small independent location with live coffee roasters inside.

The place is simple and a bit small so you may find it quite packed during the day but, if you find a seat, you can enjoy a good coffee, some nice muffin and quiche.

Prices are in some measure below the average and the aroma of roasted coffee in the air is a nice touch

Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Really enjoyed the food, large portions and good quality. Limited beer selection, but nice wines. Prompt service. All four of us were surprised and happy with the size of the bill at the end of the meal.
Very cozy place. The food was excellent. So was the wine. If you love fish this is the right place. Will come back for sure.
Lovely little place. Great food, good atmosphere, great service. Would thoroughly recommend!
Food was great, service was great and the company was great. A very enjoyable lunch. The food took a long time to arrive but was totally fine as we were after a relaxed enjoyable lunch.
Highly recommended. Great food options, staff and absolutely lovely location. If seafood is what you are looking for this is the best option you can go for

My friends and I visited Cafe Domenico last night on a one of my friends recommendation.  She described it as her favourite place and visits often, knowing how good her taste is I was so looking forward to trying it for myself.

I was not disappointed and it lived up to the high expectations she set!

The owner Karen is so welcoming and friendly with great chat, you can tell how much she loves this place.  Tony is the best waiter, tones of quips and couldn’t do more for us.  And although I didn’t meet the chefs I can tell you how good their food is.

I had the arancini rice balls to start, crispy on the outside, just the right amount of goo on the inside. Perfect!

Then had the beef lasagna for mains and what a portion!!  I almost finished it, because I didn’t want to stop eating it, but trust me these portions are huge!  I don’t think I’ve ever had better, so delicious.

Can’t wait to return again and have been telling all my friends how amazing it was 😊💖
I’d been meaning to go here for ages and when I finally did, it did not disappoint. I had the Mexican toasted wrap and it was awesome! Friendly service too, and the cakes looked incredible.

Amazing restaurant.....lovely cosy atmosphere, very friendly staff and an owner who took the time to chat to us and make us feel welcome. And the food was gorgeous, made from scratch, piping hot and majorly tasty. This is my new favourite restaurant 👏👏👏 . Would highly recommend!
A brilliant small Italian restaurant with great food, service and wine.  Well priced.
Amazing wraps and super helpful staff. I'd recommend ordering ahead through the website if you get a take out for lunch though as it gets quite busy.

I thoroughly enjoyable food experience, from the moment we were greeted at the door to the moment we left the staff were excellent, every single morsel from the 8 course tasting menu was a delight, and the discovery selection of wines to go with each dish was perfect.  There were some challenging items on the menu, but each taste, and texture was lovely, sumptuous sauces and perfectly balanced flavours.  I'd strongly recommend it.

The Martin Wishart is one of the best restaurants in Edinburgh. The food is simply spectacular. Each dish is a taste explosion, they look and taste great. Really complicated dishes executed perfectly. Excellent wine list. You have to book a month in advance and we were lucky to get a table. You have to do this. I'm going back next time I'm in Edinburgh
Great food. Excellent service. I recommend tasting menu with wine matching. Well worth  the money. Classic interior design bright and warm.

We were let down by local place so asked if RMW  could accommodate us. No problem. And the tasting menu was lovely. Still my favourite restaurant in UK. Thanks for fitting our group of 5 in.  Karen. X

Well it's just beautiful. Amuse bouche was stunning, could not fault any of the dishes, memorable scallops and completely and utterly divine chocolate and praline dome. Couldn't mark it down if I wanted to, but considering the waiting staff were all wonderful without exception, even after having an unexpected change in our reservation. I will most definitely be back.

Super cool monument!! It's an impressive structure even from far away, but close up is even better! My husband has the close up pics, def worth a visit. The surrounding grounds are nice and seem like a lovely place to visit on a nice day!

Beautiful architectural Place. U can go till up to have a good view of the city. But there is a time limit till 5 p.m. It is near the princess garden and it is also surrounded by a beautiful garden. It near by the main railway station.

Didn't go up the tower as prices seemed pretty steep but the monument was pretty impressive to look at from the ground. It is an iconic gothic building that can be seen for miles around. Sitting center of the monument is a statue of Sir Walter Scott and the entire building acts as a memorial to him.

An iconic monument in the heart of Princes Street.  A great historic landmark to use if you are meeting someone and a great starting point for your day out in Edinburgh.  Close to the train station and tram and bus stops.

This is an excellent place to get some views of Edinburgh , i would say history with a challenge. This is certainly the place to give you an insight into Sir Walter Scott as well giving you a challenge of climbing all the way to the top ( it is not for the faint-hearted ) On reaching the top you get some excellent views of old Edinburgh and all its skyline. I was lucky to be there during the Christmas market and Fair in Princes Street gardens.

One of the greatest collections of art in a single place I've seen. Lots of Scottish artists and huge paintings. The staff are very nice and helpful as well. Could easily spend a whole day here. Right next to the Princes Street Gardens as well so very chilled day.

Would recommend for people into art. Try to go for the special exhibitions if possible.

Stunning artwork. And they alow photos to be taken inside. Some work was being carried out when we visited. But a large section was still on display, well worth a visit. And would certainly go again.

If you are in Edinburgh, it is well worth taking the time to call in and view the stunning artwork. What ever style of artwork you like you should find something you can appreciate.
Loved visiting this place. There's just so much history and variety and I especially liked the Modern Art section. Highly recommend if you're a fan of the Arts.
Fantastic collection of art from some really well known artists. Free entry. A good place to spend a couple of hours.

This a nice place to see some art! The best thing is that it's totally free! If you just got done the castle, walk down to the Gallery for a bit, plus theres more to do other than the gallery where its located. 

Be prepared to carry your bag on your chest on on your side as that is their bag policy.

One of the greatest collections of art in a single place I've seen. Lots of Scottish artists and huge paintings. The staff are very nice and helpful as well. Could easily spend a whole day here. Right next to the Princes Street Gardens as well so very chilled day.

Would recommend for people into art. Try to go for the special exhibitions if possible.

Stunning artwork. And they alow photos to be taken inside. Some work was being carried out when we visited. But a large section was still on display, well worth a visit. And would certainly go again.

If you are in Edinburgh, it is well worth taking the time to call in and view the stunning artwork. What ever style of artwork you like you should find something you can appreciate.
Loved visiting this place. There's just so much history and variety and I especially liked the Modern Art section. Highly recommend if you're a fan of the Arts.
Fantastic collection of art from some really well known artists. Free entry. A good place to spend a couple of hours.

This a nice place to see some art! The best thing is that it's totally free! If you just got done the castle, walk down to the Gallery for a bit, plus theres more to do other than the gallery where its located. 

Be prepared to carry your bag on your chest on on your side as that is their bag policy.

Very moving experience.
Great to see how the Georgian gentry lived, but shocking to fully  appreciate it was built on the backs (literally) of fellow human beings.
Definitely worth a visit but only 4 stars as no access to top floor where servants lived. Would have been useful to see the contrast between upstairs downstairs living

Important period house representing a key moment in Bristol's history. The Georgian House was lived in and owned by a sugar plantation owner John Pinney and his family. With land and business interests in Nevis Island in the Caribbean, the owner and family are closely linked to the transatlantic slave trade. One of the enslaved then liberated Africans, a man called Pero returned to Bristol from Nevis to work as a servant to the family. He is memorialised elsewhere in Bristol with Pero's Bridge on the docks. The house is now a museum open Sat - Tues 11am - 4pm. Donations welcomed.
Very important witness of the past! Beautiful piece of architecture and priceless value of interiors
Illustrative place. Good for children.
Considering that it’s free, it’s a lovely way to spend some time on a rainy day.
We came here in the end of October. Our visit, made by Haleigh was AMAZING! We clearly enjoyed doing this tour. The staff is so nice... Thank you!

Not a review of the distillery as such, but what comes out is fantastic, their gin is right up there on my 'keep in stock' list.  As a ginoholic who is making it their duty to try every gin going I found theirs really ticked the box and would 100% recommend!
The tour is great and very informative. It gives a very good insight into the history of Gin production. You also get to taste some.

Had a great tour yesterday. Really interesting and informative talk about history of gin in general and specific to Edinburgh. Up close to the stills which was good. Finished off with a small group chatting about gin as we tasted the different products Edinburgh Gin produce.
A first class tour and good value for money. 
Would recommend to any gin lover.
Very informative tour. Didn't know if I liked gin. Did by the end of it. Nice sampling in a small cozy room with other tourists.

This is a simple basic cafe. It's not very expensive. Service is good and the food is good a my d good value. 
I just had a toastie and a coffee. My friend had tea. It came to £4.60, so good value.
Friendly staff, fresh and tasty food in good price, especially for a place in city centre.

I've been ordering from here for years as I work nearby. Best value food in central Edinburgh. Breakfast and burgers are great. The staff get our orders wrong half the time which is a running joke in our work but we enjoy their banter. Best to phone in advance.
You can get some great deals & staff are really very friendly and helpful
Bit small but great when your in a rush amd need a good homly pick me up x

It is even suspicious that this place has so many good reviews.
We had a fish cake, fish and chips and pies on Tuesday night, They are all dry and hard, they are clearly been in a warmer for long. Never go back again. Tesco chippy is a lot better than this.
Great place, friendly staff. My first time in Edinburgh, went here for the (in)famous deep-fried Mars bar. It wasn't bad, but almost certain won't be trying again :)
Great fish n chips but for a kiwi very overpriced. Having everything cooked and ready makes ordering and getting your food very fast. Staff looked happy and like they were having fun.
All the fried food you could wish for. Best bit was the deep fried creme eggs.
Great Fish and Chips. Nice Staff. I definitely recommend.

Thoroughly enjoyed my delicious vegan brownie! Very moist and rich, possibly the best vegan brownie I have ever had. Loved the veggie haggis, always a favourite of mine and the chickpea curry I had last week was also excellent. A good selection of salads and range of plant based milks. Plus loved the pistachio and orange cake I had the other day, very tasty indeed.

Excellent informal vegetarian dining. I liked the canteen style service. The portions were huge and the food was delicious. We had a 3 scoop salad to share with our mains but to be honest we could easily have been satisfied with just a 2 scoop salad each. If you're looking for an informal lunch or dinner and want the bonus of it being ethical then this is well worth a visit.

Visited Hendersons for lunch.  The food is delicious and the staff are very friendly.  And all very reasonably priced.  There is plenty of room and inside is very comforting.  The staff were very accommodating on having a buggy with us.  The reason for a four star review however, is the changing facilities were quite dirty, which was disappointing.

This restaurant has never changed. Been eating here forever. Great restaurant for lunch for those of us who enjoy whole foods, salads and vegetarian and vegan options. I went for the vegan pizza and two salads. Good size portions and reasonably priced.  It can get very busy here, and seating gets difficult...many customers grab a table before they have bought their food. Late lunchtimes are no problem.
And again I visited the Henderson's two times. For fresh vegan food it's just plain awesome. Love their vegan Haggis. Prices are average Edinburgh range. Staff very friendly.

This is a little gem of a restaurant in William Street, Edinburgh. The food is delicious and filling. The staff are warm and welcoming. I would definitely recommend that you give this place a visit, you will not be disappointed.
Good value lunch menu. Lots of choice and delicious. Not many customers but that's their loss. Will be back soon.

As wondrous as ever.  Quality of quisine continues to be consistent over the
decades that I have been a customer.  Service,  as ever, impeccable.  Well worth a visit over Christmas as the street's festive illuminations are   particularly atmospheric.
Food lovely but I don't like the fact that the bill was written in Chinese, prices are through the roof!!

Wow! What a restaurant ... possibly the best Chinese around fife and Edinburgh! The roast pork dumplings are superb I order about 6 every time we go. The food is simply amazing and the staff are so pleasent and welcoming. Would really recommend trying this restaurant but please don't be fooled by the way it looks... it's incredible
A delicious meal.  Really gracious and caring staff.  Not too intrusive.  A definite for our next visit to Edinburgh.  Highly recommended.  You will enjoy your visit.
Lovely food and service. Some of the food was only warm and not hot but overall the food was great. Would definitely return.

We just needed a place to escape from the cold and sleet. Ducked in for the heat, and stayed for the delicious Thai food and friendly service. Ordered the Pad Thai, vegetarian soup and were not disappointed.
Fabulous food, lovely service. Great for Coeliacs. Always a wonderful time here
Love this place so much. The best Thai food, cooked perfectly and great service. We always go here when we are in Edinburgh ♥
One of the best afternoon tea which i had. The food, tea and coffee are amazing. The place is really nice and quiet. The staff are friendly. Highly recommended.

Excellent afternoon tea with great tea selection. The pastry was however somewhat of a let down. But maybe my standards are too high, being used to French, very sophisticated pastries. Nevertheless, I had a wonderful time at an amazing location. To be recommended!

The best tea time in Edinburgh, in my opinion. Sometimes during the weekend you get live harp as well ! The place is beautiful, the staff is great, the chef is creative. It is pricey of course, but it is worth it.

Food lovely but sadly service dissapointing.  We never had the same server, we had to ask for more tea never offered.  Others around us offered tea and coffee.  We went in at 4pm and had to leave at 6.40pm carrying our cakes as we didn't have time to eat them. We waited 45 minutes till someone asked did we want the cakes and pastries.  Heard such good things but service let this beautiful building and afternoon tea down .
Excellent experience, atmosphere,  food and service. First time visit and  not the last. Well done all involved.

Awesome castle to visit.  One of the best I have been to.  The castle offers commanding views of the city of Edinburgh.  Lots of great exhibits to what life was once like in the castle.  The also have exhibits discussing the various branches of the armed forces, their exploits and sacrifices.  There is a dog cemetery for regimental dogs.  If you want a deeper dive into the history you can higher a guide, use a tour, or purchase the audio tour add on.  They are not necessary but for history buffs they will be well worth it.  If you were selecting one of these options be prepared to spend at least 2-3 hours at the castle.  Even without them you can easily spend an hour and that is rushing through and not having to stand in line.  Do yourself a favor and purchase your tickets ahead of time.  Otherwise you may have a long wait.  Also dress appropriately.  It is cold and windy on top of Castle Rock.

Amazing Castle overlooking the entire city of Edinburgh. You can actually see the old town and new town divide from the castle. Castle is very impressive with lots of history to learn. There are lots of little areas inside the castle to see, I won't ruin them for you :). The surrounding ding shopping and dining is also very good. This castle is a must see if you are visiting Edinburgh for the first time.

Edinburgh Castle was truly incredible and a must see while in Edinburgh. It’s exactly what you think of when you think of grand medieval castles and you could easily spend hours exploring all the grounds and history here. Plus the views from the top of the castle are great and you can walk around the entirety of the walls which was awesome.

If you are in Edinburgh you have to visit the castle. You can definitely see the amount of attention to details and how well maintained everything is. The place is very rich with history and stories. Consider spending a couple of hours here and definitely go for buying your tickets online to avoid spending a lot of time in the lines. Enjoyed the visit and as well the view you get with the city.

A must see if in Edinburgh.   Just the view alone was fantastic. Pictures do not do it justice.  It is well preserved and you have many places to explore on the grounds.  We did the audio tour and liked it but I think the guided tour would have been more fun but we did not have the time.  We got our tickets to the Castle from the Edinburgh Hop-On-Hop-Off Tour we purchased which saved us some money.

A beautiful building with some very important people remembered there. The entrance fee is voluntary but is worth it, even if you make a smaller donation everything helps to maintain the building. The cafe downstairs is very good, reasonably priced with home made dishes and friendly staff

Its a £5 suggested donation and a further £2 to take photos inside. The window panels are amazing and have great detail and like all old churches the organ looks amazing. The separate little chapel on the side has an amazing history around the Scottish Knights. Nice place to visit.

Wonderful Cathedral. They are, of course, a dime a dozen, but this one is truly special. Absolutely incredible artwork and architecture. A gigantic and beautiful organ. Definitely a great place to visit.

Founded in 1124, restored in 14th century, such back and forth with various religions - a dream for history lovers and still a practicing church. The Thistle Chapel is a must see with chairs for the 16 Knights of the Order and one for the Queen.  I've seen grander churches, but the history here is remarkable.  There was no entry fee but a box for donations.
If in the area, stop in. It’s a beautiful cathedral full of history. We also enjoyed a cup of coffee in the cafe. Lovely cathedral in the middle of historic Edinburgh!

Never before been to a graveyard that also double ups as a tourist attraction. Went here specifically to find a few of the gravestones that inspired the names in Harry Potter. Good central location and has a map at the front showing where famous people are buried. For the Harry Potter gravestones though, you will need to follow a guide online as these are not listed.

I have eaten my lunch here a bunch of times usually quiet so I and a friend would just sit and have a natter, there are always tourists but it's very beautiful in spring and summer, very close to the grass market so after you have a look around the kirk you can grab some food or whatever.  It's probably one of the city's most visited locations. It has rich history not just of greyfriars Bobby but of those who are buried here.

We popped in looking for the graves that allegedly inspired names from Harry Potter, but ended up staying for over an hour just walking around and looking at the beautiful skyline and interesting tombstones. Very peaceful and so much history!

This kirkyard is a good place to see some really old and historic graves. The tale of Grey Friars Bobby a little dog who used to sleep on his dead masters grave. Guided tours pass through here but also nice to just stroll around. Statue of dog at entrance. Disney did a movie Grey Friars Bobby which will give you a good insight into the story.

We stopped here on our walking tour of the city.  The gravestones were interesting to read and to think about JK Rowling's inspiration from this place.  The story about Greyfriar's Bobby was touching - now I want to see the movie.  It was astounding to hear that over 200,000 were buried here, mostly in unmarked graves, during the plague.  The open air prison was a grim story.

Always a queue to get in and always busy but its great, even for us big kids. Try the vortex tunnel- if you're brave! Loved the mirror maze too. It's especially good for hands on learning for kids. Would definitely recommend a visit.

Loved visiting camera obscura during our stay in Edinburgh. I was astonished to see different types of illusions they have at all three floors. It was a great experience and a must visit when you're in Edinburgh. It shouldn't take more than an hr (depends on your energy level) to visit all floors. I particularly enjoyed their mirror room.

I'm 28, going on 29... and this place still made me happy and extremely satisfied. I had fun like little kids! So much fun things to see and do there. I was alone so you might need some help from others to take your pictures while you are there :) Top floor has a very nice rooftop view of beautiful Edinburgh. If you are in town, this place is a must! 2 hours will be plenty enough.

Fantastic venue, warm welcome for both humans and four legged friends. The staff were incredibly attentive towards my dog and the tour at the top was insightful and enjoyable. Could not recommend this tourist attraction any more. Excellent. 5 stars all the way.

A great, unusual, hands on, brilliant day out. Not really suitable for really young children. We'll priced spent a good three hours wandering around. Highly recommended if you are staying or visiting Edinburgh.

Has to be just about the best museum experience that I have been to. Something for everyone, and especially good for kids. Masses of interactive exhibits and all really well done. If you have young kids, do yourself a favour and take them here. It's free as well! Brilliant day out.

We spent hours here, delving through the beautiful history of Scotland and it's people. We started at the top floor and slowly worked our way down. Every floor was worthwhile, the displays and exhibits were very well done. They were very informative and visually appealing. We spent three weeks in Europe and this was one of our favorite museums by far.

The best museum in Edinburgh, so much to learn. New displays are added and always some exhibition is present. There are kids activities during festivals and holidays. My son lives visiting museum and playing with the interactive displays. Equally enjoyable for whole family. Good facilities like baby rooms, family picnic area, toilets, cafe etc. A complete visit can take whole day,so plan to split to multiple visits to see everything in detail.

Huge place in a beautiful building. So much to explore and great place even with children! You can spend the whole day here discovering and playing with the kids. It’s free and donation recommended. There are special exhibitions that require tickets for example Robotics exhibition and Adults cost £10 each, children under 16 is free.

Great experience! Go there! With kids or without. It was really great. Awesome museum, themes are animals (from dinosaurs to living animals), cars, airplanes, telecommunication.

A lot of things to see and try out.

This museum is a prime example of how a museum should be and that it can be interesting for everyone and every age.

Cheers!
A mini musical instrument museum and definitely worth going to see it. It has a great collections of different instruments, very interesting!

Beautiful wee space with interesting rotational exhibitions on both ground and upper floor. Also worth a visit in itself, the cafe here (Milk) is the best in the area with amazing coffee and a strong seasonal food offering. The cafe is popular and can get busy at peak times due to its central location. Bookshop is also great to browse and the books selected have been well curated.
One do the best contemporary art galleries in Scotland. Great book shop and a bite at Cafe Milk is definitely worth a stop just for those.
A cute small gallery, with a cafe and gift shop. Right across the road from the City Art Centre, so makes a good art day out as both galleries have free entry.
Too cold, heater not working. Sat there with coat on for the whole duration of business meeting. Service was good, staff were friendly and efficient.

A nice alternative to the coffee shops in Waverley Station. The Fruitmarket Gallery is an interesting place. They have good coffee and cakes in the cafe, a wee gift shop and some art on display. It's just outside the "rear entrance" to Waverley Station, but if you're afraid to wander away from Princes Street, you'll never see it.

Excellent venue. Good exhibition. Good stall was super expensive and not worth it. This is meant to be about giving children the chance to learn things they might not do at school, not rip the parents of for food and drinks.

Really great free exhibitions but venue is a bit of a missed opportunity - loads of unused space and the shop is not very exciting or well stocked. Cake and drinks seem to have improved however since Mimi's Bakehouse moved in to the cafe attached, enjoyed a good flat white and peanut butter brownie (tasty but enough for 4).

I normal do parody reviews, but I won't this time because this place is excellent. It's a free art gallery in the city centre with a great rotation of modern exhibits. It's also really approachable if you're not into galleries. You just go up the stairs and look at stuff.
Great art gallery with a wide range of exhibitions. Really looking forward to the Victoria Crowe show starting soon. Minis bakehouse runs the cafe, so fantastic food and drink.
Just brilliant time for Edinburgh Science Festival during Easter holidays. Clean. Busy cafe. Ridiculously priced cakes.

Creepy dolls and toys of yesteryear.  Took us back to playing in the street until it got dark and times when kids used their imagination to play. Lovely to see the look on some children's faces as their parents explained how it used to be. Well presented over 5 floors.

This was a very interesting museum. The different childhood toys and clothes were fascinating to look at. There were even toys from when we were very little that our parent's and grandparents would have played with. All in all, a good hour or so of exploring. 😊

Wonderful memories from our childhood fun days. A very popular place to visit. Not far from there, there is a small place, museum, with Greyfriers Bobbie's drinking bowl and collar. Sorry can't remember the name of the museum but it's nearby .

History of childhood through a number of incredible exhibits, some of which I remember and some I definitely don't. There are also a number of seriously creepy looking dolls (see attached photos). The museum is on a number of floors, nicely set out and with some good "set pieces" of rooms, school rooms, shops, etc. There's also a nice little shop where you can buy reproductions of some of the games on display. Definitely well worth a visit.
Lots of memories. Few floors of fun. I's great and free. Toilets on side. Elevator. Walking distance from train station. Going back for sure!

Unexpected and delightful free small museum. The courtyard has an interesting and growing number of flagstones with dedications to Scotland's writers. The museum has collections of various objects telling the stories of the lives of Scott, Stevenson and Burns. Steep stairs but plenty of seating, including a sofa with a selection of poetry periodicals to browse.

This is a great little museum. And a must visit. I really like Treasure Island and seeing all the Robert Lewis Stevenson details was great.

An amazing building too.

There is a nice suvinear shop as well.
The building is interesting, but it had nothing to deal with writers. What's inside about writers seems a bit random. I liked the old pictures of Stevenson's travels.
Lovely little museum just off the Royal Mile, very quaint and quirky, but packed with terrific exhibits and information about local writers. We particularly liked the Robert Louis Stevenson section.
Such a nice little museum! A very pleasant way to learn about Scotland's 3 most famous writers. The gift shop has nice merchandise for readers.

This photographic gem is, in my opinion, underappreciated and often passed by tourists.

Be brave, wander inside, enjoy the current exhibitions then go downstairs to the small library area which has a wealth of books, magazines and photographic resources (and free wifi!).

There are specialist facilities such as darkroom for hire too.

An Introduction to Photoshop by Luke
Thank you for a very useful weekend in which we were guided through the software and allowed to explore further afield as we needed. I'd go again, and warmly recommend others to try a course there.

A very interesting and ever changing photography exhibition venue. The themes and content are very inspiring and the presentation is always high quality.

The centre also boasts some well kitted out education rooms where courses on Photoshop and other industry standard software are taught. 

It is worth checking in advance the upcoming exhibitions as there is generally something for everyone. 

Stills is located on Cockburn street an area that has a lot of eclectic shops, bars, cafes and restaurants. Fans of Stills would also likley enjoy the Fruitmarket Gallery located on a market Street not far from the rear entrance to Edinburgh Waverly Train Station.
Great gallery. Every exhibition is interesting, and very nice staff.

When I travel I like to check out photography exhibitions for entertainment and to energise. And Edinburgh has Stills. Stills is just a pure photography (free!) gallery hit on one of the most beautiful streets in the world, Cockburn street just off the Royal Mile. Right now there is two exhibitions on. One is Advertising photography from Margaret Watkins around a hundred years back, which I really liked. And Cyanotypes from Anna Atkins which look very scientific. If you love photography then definitely check out Stills whilst your in Edinburgh!
The staff are very friendly. They run all sorts of hands on photography, darkroom, lightroom, photoshop and other computer related courses. I hear the teachers are excellent!
A mini musical instrument museum and definitely worth going to see it. It has a great collections of different instruments, very interesting!

Amazing food, but they could improve on customer service....each time we go there our request of getting water gets completely ignored by a waiter (small and "round one")...only asking the main owner (probably) solves the problem...otherwise you can't ask for a better food probably in the town for this price....plus the place has a very authentic setting....highly recommended, provided they will not ignore requests for getting water...
Affordable price and the food portion is so big. My advise is to share 1 plate with 2 persons.  The food is very yummy and the place is cosy. This place is also famous for locals and foreigners.

This unassuming little cafe serves the most delicious food. The welcome is warm and the owner is super friendly. Ideal for a quick bite before or after theatre round the corner. I’ve been going here for years and still love it, even though in the same week I’ve eaten Michelin *!
Lamb curry amazing love the big nan bread they do freshly cooked
I have been dining here on and off for 40 years! Always a warm welcome and amazing food.

Hog roast - if you like it. It's a small shop and a good stop if you are looking for a snack or a meal to go. Not a lot of seating and can be quite crowded.
Oink is a chain selling hog roast. They have a whole hog roasting in the store and you get to choose how you want to have your meat (size and toppings). Have been to different outlets a few times during my time in Edinburgh - quite good what they offer.

Best hog roast in a roll I've ever had! Very quick service - got through the queue quickly. Some seating (which was not all taken even though it was busy). Nice, friendly, happy staff. The meat itself was great - very moist. No complaints!

Amazing as you'd expect from it's popularity. Crackling is everything and you don't have to pay extra for it. But the place is tiny and was very busy around lunch time. We did manage to perch on stools but had a lot of people stood around us. There is another one around 10 min walk towards the high street in new town that looked bigger and less crowded.

Absolutely love visiting this place every time I am in Edinburgh. The food and the portion size has never disappointed. 

The selection is of course limited to pork as shown but the sizes and what is included with the main filling does vary and you can specify what you would like to complete your perfect hog roast bap 😍

The place is small but there is places to sit at the front and back of the store. 

Staff have always been extremely friendly & chatty. I’ve heard them explain to tourists many times how it works and it’s always been very polite and welcoming. 

Recommend this place to anyone.

It's a really tiny place, but the line moves quickly. The hog roast is amazingly moist and flavorful. I went with the sage & onion and chili jam on white and boy was it good! My daughter had the same, but with the BBQ sauce, which unfortunately wasn't nearly as good.

Fabulous authentic food. Nice chilled atmosphere and friendly staff. My only minus was one person waited so long get their main, the rest of us had finished.  That definitely wouldn't put me off going back again. Very reasonably priced. Central location.
This place looks deceiving, but what a little gem. The food is amazing, fresh, the flavours are out of the world. The customer service is spot on and I love the history behind it.

Ordered the char siew noodles and it was pretty tasty and was a good portion. Also ordered the deep fried curry squid and that was just SUPER DELICIOUS. Prices can be a bit expensive and waitresses can be a bit more friendly maybe, but other than that everything was great

Delicious food all round. I visited with my family for dinner, the 4 of us ordered 5 dishes to share between us. The salted fish and minced pork rice was authentic and not often found in menus. The chao kota teow, crispy squid and curry laksa noodle were all cooked to perfection. My recommendation is the golden spicy chicken. Not too spicy but so much flavour and tender. All for about 40 pounds! As good as you get in Asia.
Great place for unpretentious, cheap Malaysian food! My go-to meal has to be the Sweet and Sour Chicken and Rice or the Roast Duck Noodles!

I've been going to this baker for many years and it has an undeniable quality that few other bakers in the city can match. It's small and has limited seating, but it's all about the takeaway option- especially in the summer or during the festival.

My favourite is the cheeseburger puff: a light pastry, with relish and  sausage centre flattened to look like a burger.

best pie shop in town and really good value, the staff are really lovely folk and i love being a regular at this place. its really good for take aways and quick snacks and beats Greggs any day with similar pricing too at that! 😁 whats not to like, a big 5 stars from me ☺️

Popped in to try the traditional scotch pie and was overwhelmed with choices. If this was on my door step I'ld be going here everyday for lunch.
Was able to sit inside and eat the pie however the seated area is small (3/4 chairs). Would say its more of a take away than a stay and eat. Enjoy

Pies were amazing but you really have to be there to get the one you want before they run out! I really wanted to try the Chicken Haggis Pie, but settled for the Beef Pepper Pie, which was also delicious!

This is a great cheap eat that doesn't brake the wallet! Highly recommend it.
Lovely little shop specialising in bakery pie products including the infamous Scotch Pie. First time trying one but it was absolutely delicious. Cheap too at just £1.45 for a thick meaty pie.

Being French desperately missing cheese... We were happy to find out about the fondue evening on Monday. The quantities were more than enough and the food really tasty. The staff is very professional and friendly. They speak French, so it is a good opportunity if you went to have a little break from English (or if you want to test yourself ;) ). I recommend!

Our Food was absolutely amazing!! (The pictures speak for themselves)
Real French feeling while sitting in here. Very courteous staff. We will definitely go there the next time when we're in Edinburgh.
Fantastic place for family lunch or romantic dinner. Always fresh and beautiful dishes. Very friendly staff great atmosphere 5+

Once again we were not disappointed.
Super food. Great atmosphere friendly service.
Roll on our next visit.
Merci beaucoup Petit Paris.
Great food and atmosphere. Fantastic service even though very busy. Prices very reasonable given it's location.
This restaurant is now renamed as "Nilgiri Spices". Very good environment.

One of the worst restaurant in Edinburgh.
We been to the restaurant and Oder some food ,  I hv been there with my wife order dosa and some Indian curry they bring  dosa first and other food after we finished dosa. 
For me this is one and only one worst restaurant in Edinburgh 
Evan I don’t recommend only one to go this dirty place Evan service is worst staff no have any dance to speak to the customer, food taste is horrible.
To go this restaurant is the wastage of time any money
One if the best curries I've had and byob

Most authentic and delicious Indian food (let alone South Indian food) I’ve had in Scotland. I’m from the US, and this place has by far the best chaya (or chai as some of you like to say) I’ve ever had outside of India. When you ask for tea and they ask you “which kind”, make sure you say you want the Indian style tea, not the British. Your welcome in advance.

A must visit for anyone looking for good authentic south indian food. Generous serving at  reasonable price. Much better than other high street curry houses.

 Friendly and polite staff :)

Good luck with the new name 'Nilgiri Spice'👍
A delicious meal.  Really gracious and caring staff.  Not too intrusive.  A definite for our next visit to Edinburgh.  Highly recommended.  You will enjoy your visit.
Lovely food and service. Some of the food was only warm and not hot but overall the food was great. Would definitely return.

We just needed a place to escape from the cold and sleet. Ducked in for the heat, and stayed for the delicious Thai food and friendly service. Ordered the Pad Thai, vegetarian soup and were not disappointed.
Fabulous food, lovely service. Great for Coeliacs. Always a wonderful time here
Love this place so much. The best Thai food, cooked perfectly and great service. We always go here when we are in Edinburgh ♥
Great South Indian cuisine at reasonable prices. We come here at least once a week. Highly recommended
Really unpleasant flavours, neon coloured sauce. Left most of it. Expensive and bland. the food came incredibly quickly which was not a good sign. So bad, it really quite upset our evening.
Worst Korma ever. It didn’t seem to have any coconut in it (my favourite) but did seem to have a tin of tomato soup in it. Such a shame as I had been really looking forward to it.
Still good the other day but not as amazing as I remember it was a few years ago
Absolutely awesome food. Staff extremely helpful and pleasant. Great place.  Highly recommend! Great value too.

If you want authentic south Indian cuisine then be sure to check this place out. It's not a fancy restaurant but the fact that it was full and they were turning away a steady stream of people tells you its worth it. 
Book a table to avoid disappointment.
Great food. Highly recommended. Put it this way I have been to similar restaurants in Glasgow and paid 3 times the price. The food was the same! Genuine authentic food. Recommended.
Very unusually, very tasty food. Went for lunch and you get a  platter of small delicious dishes. Can't wait to go back for dinner
Decent Dosa with tasty chicken and vegetables curry inside. The place is quite small and can be quite noisy when it is full, but will definitely come again to try other dishes.

Waste of time. In the name of South Indian cuisine they serve mainly north Indian food. It's kind of cheating. I'm very disappointed. Opening/closing hours is ridiculous. They  open it only when they have free time in a day and close it otherwise. Open in a short window of time for lunch. Non sense. Paying expensive bill for a north Indian food.
When looking through the telescope consider the heavenly fingers which created the moon and stars. How excellent is our God who has set His glory above the heavens - psalm 8 (kjv)

Iconic building on the Blackford Hill, Edinburgh. Dates from 1902. Disappointingly  no live observations from here although the original towers still exist.  Some of the copper cladding has had to be replaced and looks slightly incongruous by comparison with the original . Some lectures take place over the winter. months
Brilliant views of the city and a lovely place to learn about space. The hill up there is a bit steep but it's well worth the effort once you reach the top!
Great views from the hill, not very informative or helpful other than the open days.

Total joke of a place to bring 70 seater bus round despite a bus bay being in place. But no road markings stating bus bay. No yellow lines round the turning circle. Turning circle too small for buses. Last time I bring anyone here. Especially tourists spending money in our capital.
